name: Mini Fried Donut Holes
directions: Pour about 1/2 inch (1.3 cm) of oil into a large pot and heat to 355°F (180°C).
In a bowl, whisk together flour, 1/4 cup sugar, baking powder, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk buttermilk and melted butter until combined (make buttermilk by combining 1 cup milk with 1 tablespoon vinegar and letting it sit for 5 minutes).
Pour wet mixture into dry ingredients and stir gently with a fork until just combined. Do not overmix.
Fry half the dough balls at a time until golden brown on the bottom, then flip and cook the other side.
Remove with a slotted spoon or spider strainer and drain on paper towels.
Roll warm donuts in the remaining sugar to coat evenly.
Repeat with remaining dough and serve warm.
